title: Design and Implementation of a Clinical Decision Support System (CDSS) for Fall Detection
description: The CDSS fall detection system were implemented in a course about applied digital health. During an 8 week period, I got to work as part of a team in order to program a single chip computer to send live time-series data to a local server. The data would then be processed and fed into a rule-based classifier which would classify if a person had fallen or not.

title: Ant Colony Optimization Algorithm
description: As a part of a course in Stochastic Optimization Algorithms (FFR105), I implemented an Ant Colony Optimization Algorithm to solve the Traveling Salesman Problem (TSP).

title: Particle Swarm Optimization Algorithm
description: As a part of a course in Stochastic Optimization Algorithms (FFR105), I implemented a Particle Swarm Optimization Algorithm that finds the smallest or largest value of a function.

title: Genetic Optimization Algorithm
description: As a part of a course in Stochastic Optimization Algorithms (FFR105), I implemented a Genetic Algorithm that finds the smallest or largest value of a function.

title: My Website
description: A website I independently developed to showcase the projects and work I have completed over the years, including the implementation and visualization of various algorithms. Additionally, the site provides links and information about myself.

title: Bachelor's Thesis In Computer Science & Engineering
description: A Comparison of Approaches to Image Classification using Convolutional Neural Networks

title: Wildfire Tracking Website
description: In this group project, I was responsible for extracting wildfire data from NASA, making an information view for , and the functionality of sorting wildfires given sorting criteria such as year, country, etc...

title: Object Oriented Programming In Java
description: In a fundamental Java Object-Oriented Programming course, my group completed a project that applied key OOP concepts. The project involved designing and implementing a software solution using Java, focusing on principles such as encapsulation, inheritance, polymorphism, and abstraction.

title: Calculator In Python
description: I developed a simple calculator utilizing Reverse Polish Notation (RPN) for efficient arithmetic operations. This calculator demonstrates an alternative computational method by eliminating the need for parentheses in mathematical expressions.

title: User Interface In Java(FX)
description: In my first year of school, I developed a graphical user interface (GUI) for a course on Java graphical interfaces, utilizing design patterns to ensure an effective and maintainable implementation.

title: Machine Oriented Programming & Assemblers
description: MD407 is a single-chip computer used in machine-oriented programming course at Chalmers, where both assembler and C languages are employed to develop low-level, hardware-focused applications.
